abstract.p: Papa Roach will perform at Stone Pony in Asbury Park, NJ (S)

block.p: If you like the sound of Papa Roach's single ''Last Resort,'' you'll probably enjoy the band's debut album, ''Infest,'' and their live performance, which maintains the same sledgehammer energy.

Whether they are singing about suicide (''Last Resort'') or Attention Deficit Disorder (''Thrown Away,'' which actually turns into a pretty quasi-reggae track), the high-testosterone band's pummeling, often explicit, songs contain different themes, but the same sonic buzz-saw approach. Even the sometimes introspective lyrics move at breakneck speed.
If you like the sound of Papa Roach's single ''Last Resort,'' you'll probably enjoy the band's debut album, ''Infest,'' and their live performance, which maintains the same sledgehammer energy.

Whether they are singing about suicide (''Last Resort'') or Attention Deficit Disorder (''Thrown Away,'' which actually turns into a pretty quasi-reggae track), the high-testosterone band's pummeling, often explicit, songs contain different themes, but the same sonic buzz-saw approach. Even the sometimes introspective lyrics move at breakneck speed.

Thanks to Coby Dick, the band's frontman, Papa Roach has developed a following with a sound incorporating the elements of Red Hot Chili Peppers, Nirvana, Korn and Alice in Chains, blending it into a mostly persuasive whole that might not always be as good as those parts. Papa Roach will be performing at the Stone Pony, in Asbury Park, at 7 p.m. Monday.
